title: How do Europeans deal with the Language barrier in league
body:
Like I get the whole "Just Ping 4Head" Thing but like.

on NA there is a kind of meme about players from Spanish/Portuguese speaking countries when they play on NA. They Either silently carry the game and never type anything. Or they int feed and spam chat in a language you don't understand. Also You can't really give item build advice or ask them to do something specific because you don't speak the same language.

Is there a parallel in EUW/NE of this? or does Europe handle things differently?

replies.body: We type in English? You will usually find that alot of continental western Europeans will speak english fairly well. The only ones that generally dont type in English unless they flame you are from Turkey.
Almost everyone in Europe speaks english

> Almost everyone in Europe speaks english

The younger generations will definitely speak it, they'll at the very least have some notions of it and will at some point become fluent more often then not even if only just because of using the internet lol. Then, there's the older generations, the more you go back the less likely it is that they'll speak it but you know, the cycle of life. Give it few more decades lol.

I am 35 next month and i write whole block posts in english.
Wasn't THAT good in English in school but as a gamer i got better and better since the internet and multiplayer games got more popular.

I think I can say that onlinegaming was the far better teacher than my old english teacher, lol.

I guess as passionated online gamer you get good in English over time, doesn't matter how old you are.

Most games, everyone either talks English or people utilize pings. There are the off-games where some premades start talking in their language. Sometimes, that is left alone, but sometimes, someone else on the team feels like replying to that with some stereotype-kinda remarks or maybe even xenophobic remarks. Let me give you a few examples:
For French, people reply with stuff like "oui oui baguette".
For Germans, people reply with stuff like "SAUERKRAUT" or "WURST".
The rest, I don't know. I don't pay thaaaat much attention to it on the off-chance it happens xD
But well, yeah, there obviously are stereotypes. Some people say stuff like that there should be a separate French server or a separate Polish server, because they're "so bad and never talk English". But sometimes I get 2 teammates (or 3) who are pre and happen to speak Arabic (but in Egyptian dialect) and for the most part they expect to be the only ones speaking it and are all camouflaged and all (which I am also guilty of to be honest).

However for my condition, I can use both EUW and EUNE since both have acceptable pings.
I'm from Spain and my english is fine.
Most people in my region are polish or romanian and since I'm not from one of the big countries in Europe it's often hard to understand them. But they do speak English.
There's a thing called mute allied chat, that should remain on as a requirement.

Ironically as I saw the language barrier is stronger in EUW, which consist of the major languages, such as English, French, Spanish, German, because e.g french people are reluctant to speak english or german for example. In EUNE people are more likely to speak English, even if it is gibberish, because of the language diversity. Of course people will talk in their own language, but mostly about stuff unrelated to the game. I find it rather nice to be honest, because after a while you start picking up their language and you will actually understand them. Usually in the EUNE it is mostly the polish people, who prefer their own language over english, but it's not even close to be that bad as in the case of the french. Also polish is easier to pick up than french. Furthermore most of the languages are slavic, so e.g if you start picking up czech you also get to understand slovakian, because of the similarity. Same is true for the balkans. The only problematic languages are romanian, hungarian and finnish etc., which don't really have any similar pair and are relatively harder to pick up. Especially hungarian (I'm a hungarian btw, our language is so hard that even native hungarians can't speak it properly for most part).

the whole BR thing is more than just a meme--it's a phenomenon that dates back to the golden era of online-gaming where Brazilian players would flock to, in particular, private-servers for NA-populated MMO's that didn't charge a monthly subscription-fee (which was the monetization-norm of the time)......if a game did not cost anything, the BRs would be there

beyond the racist diatribe about people who don't live in the USA not having money to spend on vidya, Brazilian gamers DID actually show up on these servers en-masse and would usually make a coordinated effort to form guilds or clans and pubstomp the shit out of whatever PvP or GvG content said server had to offer......or, they would flame other guilds/clans to no end if they didnt. regardless of either outcome, one could be certain that they would receive an abundance of jajajajajajajajaja's, huehuehuehue's and XD's. Brazilian MMO players will go down in the annuls of gaming-history for their unmatched competitive and vindictive nature

This is an interesting thread. I've never taken the time to consider how some LoL regions combine several disparate countries, each with their own language. Reading the replies about how English is usually used, I'm reminded of a story from my parents about one of their trips to Germany. They needed directions or something, so they asked a bus driver whether he spoke English. He looked at them like they were crazy and told them that of course he did. Apparently, everyone in western Europe speaks their country's native/official language for conversation with other locals and English for everything else.
